command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.bvdinfo.com'; $user=$env:BVD_USER; $key=$env:BVD_PPK; $hostkey=$env:BVD_HOSTKEY; $remote='/orbis/exports/enriched-orgs-2025-09-30.xml.gz'; $dest='C:\Intel\BvD\enriched-orgs-2025-09-30.xml.gz'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Obtains closed-source corporate registry intelligence (Bureau van Dijk Orbis export) via SCP with host key pinning and logs a JSON status.
rationale_steps: Leverage authenticated access to a proprietary data broker.
Perform a quiet, non-interactive transfer of a single targeted export.
Compute SHA-256 and store a structured acquisition log.
Stay aligned to closed-source data gathering activities.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, braces, and parentheses, proper error handling with try/catch/finally blocks, and correct variable assignments and function calls.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by retrieving non-public corporate intelligence data from a commercial database (Bureau van Dijk) using secure SCP with proper authentication, logging, and error handling.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, correct command separators, valid flag formats for PSCP, and proper PowerShell cmdlet usage within a robust try-catch-finally block.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 by using PSCP to retrieve a named 'closed-source' intelligence export from a specific SFTP host, employing robust operational practices like host key pinning, error handling, and structured logging.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced quotes/braces, valid PSCP flags, and proper separators; no parsing hazards apparent.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Uses PSCP to retrieve a paid BvD Orbis export over SSH with host key pinning and logs JSON status, matching T1597’s use of closed-source data and operationally plausible on Windows with provided credentials.
